intro: Talinum aurantiacum, commonly known as the redleaf talinum, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking red, velvety leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Talinum aurantiacum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant foliage. It prefers warm, humid climates and well-drained soil for optimal growth.
